Yes, it was quite fun

store it in a string![/quote]

Thanks for the reply. But when I meant store it I didn’t mean a value that couldn’t be changed, I meant as in I could read over what people say. So like it gets saved as a text document, I’m not sure if it’s possible though?

If you don’t get me, possibly some thing along the lines of;

new File ("./LocationA/"+Answers+".txt");

item.title: JOptionPane
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

I’m just messing around with the ‘JOptionPane’ utility and I’m stuck.

I’ve wrote all of this;

[code]import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class Dialouge{

public static void main (String args []) {
	
	String fn = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Enter your first number");
	String sn = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Enter your second number");	
	int num1 = Integer.parseInt(fn);
	int num2 = Integer.parseInt(sn);		
	int sum = num1 * num2;
	
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "The answer is " +sum, "The answer", JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE);
	
	JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "What is the name of my MX bike?", "Questionaire",
	        JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, null, new Object[] { "Amanda",
	            "Doropthy", "Pappa", "James", "Gladis", "Janet", "Jayne",
	            "Sadie", "Judie", "Kerstin", "Lotus", "Maciek", "Marj",
	            "Mandy", "Whore", d", "d", "s", "s",
	            "I", "Love", "You" }, "Dad");
		
    int response = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(null, "Do you want to continue?", "Confirm",
            JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE);
    if (response == JOptionPane.NO_OPTION) {
    	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Why did you click no paps you fucking noob!");
      } else if (response == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {
    	  JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Thanks playing my question thing that I made paps, what did you think of it?");
      } else if (response == JOptionPane.CLOSED_OPTION) {
	    	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Why did you click no, paps you fucking noob!");

}

}
}[/code]

But, what I want is when } else if (response == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) { JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Thanks playing my question thing that I made paps, what did you think of it?"); action happens, their information is stored some way, and I’m not entirely sure how to do that.

For example;

They put “Yes, it was quite fun”. How could that be stored? it doesn’t matter how it is.

(I was making this to fool around with my dad, if your wondering why it says paps etc).

Read full topic
